# Talithia Williams

Dr. Williams got a BS in Mathematics from Spellman College, an MS in Mathematics from Howard University, and a PhD (2008) in Statistics from Rice University.

from HMC:  statistical models which emphasize the spatial and temporal structure of data, and applies them to problems in the environment. She has partnered with the World Health Organization in developing a cataract model used to predict the cataract surgical rate for countries in Africa. Her research interests also include nonstationary covariance estimation and change-of-support problem
:::
